comment_data.body:
Here is a complete example.
`e.hpp`:
```C++
enum class E { A, B };
```
`e.pyx`:
```Cython
cdef extern from "e.hpp" namespace "E":
    cpdef enum E "E":
        A
        B
```

Ok, this is really getting cumbersome â€¦ :)
What other options do we have that C and/or C++ compilers would accept without complaining all too loudly? Maybe `(enum E) (0 - 1)`, without the second cast ?

I think that `(enum E) (0 - 1)` would be the same as `(enum E) -1`, as was before #2186. I can not reproduce the warning mentioned in that issue, even though I have tried various versions of gcc and clang with `-Wall`, with `enum` and `enum class`: https://godbolt.org/z/buBUI9

Apparently it is a GCC bug that `(enum E) -1` generates a warning with `-Wconversion`, since it is [documented](https://gcc.gnu.org/onlinedocs/gcc-8.2.0/gcc/Warning-Options.html) that it should "not warn for explicit casts like `abs((int) x)` and `ui = (unsigned) -1`". Moreover, the current workaround does not help gcc 5.5 and earlier, as demonstrated in https://godbolt.org/z/DlXIfA.

I propose to explicitly silence this warning with:
```C
#ifdef __GNUC__
#pragma GCC diagnostic push
#pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wconversion"
#endif

const enum E a = (enum E) -1;

#ifdef __GNUC__
#pragma GCC diagnostic pop
#endif
```
I thought that enum class is not supported yet. See, https://github.com/cython/cython/issues/1603.

They are not fully supported: for example, it seems difficult to use enum class variables as function arguments; but what Cython already has is enough to wrap them. The original example in #1603 can be encoded like this:
```
cdef extern from "headername.h" namespace "lol::rofl":
    cdef enum rofl:
        SOMETHING
        MOAR

cdef void f(int arg):
    print(arg)

f(<int>rofl.MOAR)
```

@cf-natali In Cython 3 we [do now support enum classes properly](https://github.com/cython/cython/pull/3640). Obviously that doesn't help Cython 0.29 users but going forward the thing to do is probably to use an enum class instead.

Thanks @da-woods .
Indeed, we're looking forward to Cython 3 however for now it's quite annoying for us since Cython 0.29 is used e.g. in the latest Ubuntu LTS - I assume this will affect quite a few people.

title: Cython 0.29 broke support for C++ enum classes
